readme: The final quarter marks the culmination of the SAIX project. This pack captures the atmosphere of the final audit, reflecting on five years of construction and the ultimate judgment of history.

items.headline: The Great Audit: Five Years of SAIX Under the Lens
items.body: Today marks the twentieth quarter since the SAIX initiative launched. What began as a bold promise of infrastructure evolution has reached its terminal point. Analysts are divided: did we build a sanctuary or a prison? As the final ledgers close, the cost of innovation is being weighed against the debris of the old world. The project has reached its inevitable conclusion, leaving behind a legacy that is as imposing as it is controversial.
items.flavor: The ink is dry, but the stains remain.

items.headline: MEMO: Closure of the Ledger
items.body: Five years. Twenty quarters. We have reached the threshold. You were told you were building a bridge to the future. Now, as the lights dim, we see what has truly been constructed. History does not care about your intentions, only the architecture left behind. Whether this stands as a fortress of progress or a monument to folly is no longer in your hands. Pack your belongings; the verdict has been rendered.
items.flavor: The architect rarely lives in the house they build.

items.headline: COMM: RE: Project Folly?
items.body: Subject: Legacy Check. Data suggests the SAIX structure is holding, but for whom? They think they built a fortress. We see a tomb. The ledger is finalized and the numbers do not lie. We pull the plug at midnight. Let the historians argue over the ruins; our work here is finished. The transition to the post-SAIX era begins now.
